data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Ambergris. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases. Cut Throat Boogie contained Boogieman Sam teases. Honey contained Rattlesnake teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Self-Immolate, Ambergris through Open Water, and Float Along - Fill Your Lungs have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Magenta Mountain teases. Ambergris was dedicated to the band's crew member Joe Santarpia.  The Lord of Lightning was on the printed setlist but not played, with Joey joking before Trapdoor that they only put Lord of Lightning on a setlist whenever there's a storm close to an outdoor show and it gets played if the storm hits, then he shouted out opener Jess Cornelius. Boogieman Sam contained I'm Not A Man Unless I Have A Woman, The Dripping Tap, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Cut Throat Boogie teases.

Poster By Daniel @sunflower_form

Raining Blood (Slayer) played before and as the band came on stage. The River [1] contained Wah Wah teases and parts I, II, & III were played before transitioning to Wah Wah, which contained The River teases and quotes. Part IV of the The River was played after Road Train. Ambergris was introduced as having slap bass. After Ambergris, Joey shouts out opener Grace Cummings. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung vocal jam and Witchcraft teases. Ataraxia was introduced as "Tanaraxia", which was explained to be a song about Joey wanting to be tan. Sleep Drifter contained a Doom City and Billabong Valley tease. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster by Bjenny Montero Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Ice V. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River, and subsequently contained Crumbling Castle and The River teases. Ambrose quoted It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) before Doom City. O.N.E. began with the intro to Straws in the Wind instead of the customary intro. Pleura contained a quote of “Freedom” (Rage Against the Machine). Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Russell Brand. Smoke and Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Ambergris contained an Ice V tease. Before The Reticent Raconteur, Leah Senior was introduced to the stage as “The Original Balrog” and Joey gave a shoutout to her live bass player Jack [Robbins], with the bonus trivia that he was also in Stu’s first band Almacknjack. The Reticent Raconteur was played for the first time since 2021-02-24 (61 show gap). The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning featured narration by Leah Senior. The Fourth Colour was played for the first time since 2019-11-23 (70 show gap). Am I in Heaven? contained The Dripping Tap teases. Poster by Jason Galea 800 standard / 50 Foil Print

Stu and Ambrose wished Joey a happy birthday during The Dripping Tap. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Oddlife was introduced as “Cookie’s favorite song”. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to soundman Sam Joseph and contained Cut Throat Boogie teases/quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Sleepwalker teases. Sea of Trees was introduced as “what King Gizzard was originally called” and “Lucas’s favorite song”, and contained Head On/Pill and The Bitter Boogie teases. Hypertension was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases. A New World through Altered Beast III featured Leah Senior providing narration. Alter Me I contained an Altered Beast III tease. Alter Me II and Altered Beast III were played for the first time since 2019-10-07 (90 show gap). The intro to Iron Lung featured additional vocals about “hot buns”. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Iron Lung was reprised during Mr. Beat. Joey was hit with silly string at the conclusion of the show, and Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) for the second night in a row. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea

This show featured the debut of Lava. Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. The Book was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix and featured a Cavs drum solo. The Reticent Raconteur through The Balrog featured narration by Leah Senior. The Lord of Lightning contained a Cellophane tease. The Balrog contained a Trapdoor tease. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

Poster By Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

Evil Death Roll did not include the Invisible Face section and instead featured a Hypertension-esque jam (see below). The intro to Ambergris featured musical banter regarding a “big-ass beer”. Leah Senior was shouted out prior to Crumbling Castle. KGLW.net Staff Notes: There was a good deal of discussion about whether the jam in Evil Death Roll constituted a Hypertension tease or was merely suggesting a variation on Hypertension through Stu’s playing. We decided that this example did not qualify as a “tease”, “quote”, or full “jam.” Rather than expand our lexicon to include “motif” or “theme,” we opted to simply mention and qualify it in the setlist notes. Poster By Jordan Speer

Hot Wax was announced as a dedication to Joe Santarpia, one of the band's sound engineers. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2022-04-28 (50 show gap). I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Cellophane contained Am I in Heaven? teases and Hot Wax quotes. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive ingredient in modern humanity.” Iron Lung featured an extended Red Hot Chili Peppers style intro while Lucas was using the restroom, followed by additional mid-song banter about Lucas. A New World through Altered Beast II featured Leah Senior providing the narration.

The band introduced the show by acknowledging how little they play hometown shows, citing Melbourne inner-city gentrification. Crumbling Castle was then introduced as “The Fourth Colour”, “Crumbling Castle”, and finally, “Gamma Knife”. The Fourth Colour featured a Cavs drum solo. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song that Ambrose wrote about Stu, and featured an additional verse and quotes from Sadie Sorceress. Stu sang the third verse twice instead of the second verse in Ice V. Iron Lung was introduced as a “song about vaping”. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive naturally occurring ingredient”. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam.

This show featured the debut of Gila Monster. Honey contained Billabong Valley, Automation, and Rattlesnake teases. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. The River contained Wah Wah teases. Self-Immolate contained a “Fire” (Jimi Hendrix) quote and featured a drum solo by Cavs with “Machine Gun” (Jimi Hendrix) teases. After an instrumental intro to Am I in Heaven?, Stu, Joey, and Amby discuss recent dreams before continuing with the song. The song itself contained a “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) quote as well as “Stiff Upper Lip” (AC/DC) and Rattlesnake teases. Poster By Drew Millward

Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Sense was teased immediately before and during Ice V, which contained a Hypertension tease. Ambergris was introduced as “Joey’s porno song”. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to “time to party” and “everybody wants to party”, and Cellophane teases. Boogieman Sam contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “It's a Long Way to the Top (If You Wanna Rock 'N' Roll)” (AC/DC) quotes and Am I In Heaven? teases. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster By Lewy Jones

Stu joined the opener Los Bitchos on flute for their cover of Trapdoor. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases and had some of the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrains changed to "boogie, boogie, boogie". Automation contained a false intro with Cavs playing the drumbeat to Muddy Water. Honey contained Rattlesnake quotes (with the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrain changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels"), Sleep Drifter teases and O.N.E. teases. An audience member named Mīkal was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. The O.N.E. intro contained Straws in the Wind teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as a song about monkeys, then as a song about Lucas. Planet B was introduced as a song about monkeys, then space monkeys and finally "human monkeys". Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs followed by a brief metal vamp by the band. Planet B and Self-Immolate were dedicated to Michael Badger, a sound engineer/mixer on the studio versions of the tracks. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Witchcraft teases, Am I in Heaven? teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes and Hot Water teases/quotes with lyrics changed to "time to party". Cellophane contained "animals in Australia" quotes. The Balrog contained Evil Death Roll teases and Hypertension teases & quotes. Boogieman Sam had some of the "boogie, boogie, boogie" refrains changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels" and contained “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) teases, "animals in Australia" quotes, and Hypertension teases. Evil Death Roll and Presumptuous were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

Wah Wah contained The River teases. Ambergris was introduced as a song about whale vomit. Hypertension contained Iron Lung quotes. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases and Ice V teases. Before Shanghai, which was introduced as a song about how the band almost broke up over a hot pot, but it was alright because they all turned into butterflies afterward, Stu asked the crowd if they had even seen the band at various Sydney venues (Goodgod, World Bar), then Ambrose sung some of Lunch Meat. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Hell and Predator X were on the written setlist but were not played. Poster By Rowena Lloyd

This was a fully acoustic show (except for the electric bass), the fourth such show in the band’s history ( December 13, 2021, December 19, 2021, April 13, 2022). Scheduled opening band Kamikaze Palm Tree’s set was cancelled due to an inclement weather warning. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer was played for the first time since May 8, 2022 (81 show gap). Muddy Water featured Amby on sax. The River (#1) contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah was unfinished. The River (#2) contained Wah Wah and Ice V teases. Amby dedicated Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, to his father, Broderick Smith, who passed away recently. Following The Bitter Boogie, the band teased “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) and improvised a short bluegrass tune. Following The Wheel Stu briefly left the stage; while awaiting his return Joey quoted Superbad, stating he felt like Steven Glansburg and then teased “Taylor” (Jack Johnson), Amby quoted “Beyond the Sea” (Bobby Darin) and Joey teased and quoted “Are You Gonna Be My Girl” (Jet). Presumptuous featured Stu going around to every band member and giving them a sip of champagne, as well as spraying champagne on the crowd. Most Of What I Like was played for the first time since June 1, 2022 (70 show gap) and was dedicated by Joey to his partner Edith (Amby’s sister), had Stu and Amby sitting on piano together, and contained “Praise You” (Fatboy Slim) quotes/teases. Her and I contained teases of Am I In Heaven?, “España cañí” (Pascual Marquina Narro) and Blindness (The Fall). Slow Jam 1 and Sense were on the written setlist as the final 2 songs but were not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Fans of stage banter should check out this show, as the band, especially Stu, was in a talkative mood. Discussions included the band’s ability to chill hard, how acoustic nights are like days off for Cavs to drink, and even theorizing why Stu might be more talkative tonight. Poster By Jason Galea 485 Standard / 150 Foil Prints

Stu and Joey wore overalls, which were also worn in the video for The Silver Cord. I’m Not In Your Mind contained Alter Me quotes and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Sense contained a Slow Jam 1 intro, after which Stu introduced Joey as John Frusciante and the band played a brief Red Hot Chili Peppers style jam. Sense proper contained Slow Jam 1 quotes and closed with quotes of “Incredible” (M Beat) and “Welcome to the Jungle” (Guns N’ Roses). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. Shanghai featured the “grow wings and fly” jam. Ambergris was introduced as a song about Free Willy. Hot Water had lyrics changed to “Joe Walker" and "Joey Walker." Robot Stop was unfinished and contained Hot Water teases, The Dripping Tap teases and Witchcraft teases/quotes. Lava and Gamma Knife were on the printed setlist but were not played. At the end of the show, the band thanked the crowd for coming to see the "fishermen from Australia". KGLW.net Staff Notes: There was much internal discussion as to a potential tease of the intro to Gondii in Change. The arrangement of instruments and structure of Change has been modified compared with the studio version. Though it resembles a tease of Gondii, we believe more live instances need to he heard to determine if this is intentional, or just an accentuation of the existing relationship between the songs. Poster By Jason Galea 420 Standard / 120 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

Head On/Pill contained Witchcraft teases, Ice V teases and a Motor Spirit jam. Ice V contained Witchcraft teases. Hypertension contained teases of The Dripping Tap, Am I In Heaven? and People-Vultures. The Grim Reaper contained quotes of Torture Chamber, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “Sabotage” (Beastie Boys). Poster by Bassant Ahmed

Before Theia, Ambrose quoted Fried. The song itself contained Motor Spirit quotes, a The River jam with Wah Wah quotes, and Motor Spirit and The Silver Cord jams with lyrics. Joey did Michael Jackson-style vocal improv in the intro to Ambergris, which was introduced as a song about sperm whales and contained a short drum solo. Joey did an impression of Guy Fieri before Rats In The Sky. Cavs teased Rock and Roll (Led Zeppelin) before Sad Pilot. After Rats in the Sky, the band heckled Jason Galea to join on tambourine. Before Flight b741, the band got Cavs to hit the gong on his kit. After Flight b741, the band explained that Geelong, aka G-troit, is the sister city to Detroit, as both had a Ford production factory, which closed and destroyed the town. Joey teased Purple Haze (Jimi Hendrix) and Cavs teased Rock and Roll again. You Can Be Your Silhouette contained an extended intro where the band talked about how their talkback mics work and jazz notes. During the song itself, which contained a The End (The Doors) quote, it was described as a song about being yourself. During the intro to Straws In The Wind, the band joked about Ambrose swimming over to Canada and Ambrose walked up to the lights and sound booth.  Nuclear Fusion featured Vincent, a kid from the audience on the intro. Following the intro, Joey teased Twist (Korn). After Nuclear Fusion, Stu shouted out the stream crew. Honey contained O.N.E teases. Minimum Brain Size was introduced as a song about "loser hypermasculine people."  Prior to Rattlesnake Joey conducted a Q&A session with crowd members and Sam. Prior to Billabong Valley, Cavs ran offstage. During Billabong Valley, Joey said he can do a Limp Bizkit beat cause he doesn’t have an electric guitar and doesn’t want to take it to the [Dave] Matthews Bridge, followed by Ambrose climbing on top of the equipment truck on the side of the venue, leading to the line “I’m on the truck!” Her and I (Slow Jam 2), which was last played 2023-06-18 (50 show gap), contained a Slow Jam 1 intro as well as Iron Lung teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition- 200

Audience member Joe did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. Cellophane contained I'm In Your Mind, Am I In Heaven?, and Lord of Lightning teases. Mystery Jack was last played 2022-05-31. (138 show gap) Hypertension contained Witchcraft and Hot Water teases. Ambrose did a short breakdance after his verse of Le Risque and said Raygun taught him everything he knows. The Grim Reaper contained Telescope (Ambrose Kenny-Smith & GUM), Torture Chamber, Body Movin' and Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quotes. Magenta Mountain was attempted but only a jam was played (Titled We're Doin' It Together on the Official Bootleg) because Joey's synth wasn't working. This Thing contained a The Land Before Timeland tease. The intro to Am I In Heaven? (which was not on the printed setlist) contained Lava and The Dripping Tap teases and the song itself contained a This Thing tease and a Hypertension jam with lyrics. 

Poster By Job van Rijen
Standard: 600
Gold Foil: 200

Wah Wah contained a The River intro with a Cellophane tease and the song itself contained a The River quote as well as a jam and Am I In Heaven? teases. 
Before Antarctica, which was introduced as a song about Antarctica and "Cookie's biggest regret thinking polar bears live [there]", Ambrose quoted the outro of Daily Blues. Ambergris was dedicated to sperm whales. Trapdoor was introduced as a song about "the dungeon Stu keeps Ambrose trapped in to make music". Before Black Tooth, Stu asked the crowd if anyone had been to the nine Red Rocks shows the band had done, which led Ambrose to quote Nein and say they should play it. Before People-Vultures, Ambrose quoted Walk The Dinosaur (Was (Not Was)). People-Vultures itself contained Iron Lung quotes. Mr. Beat contained an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Flight b741 was dedicated to Lucas. Theia contained The Silver Cord quotes. Gilgamesh contained Gila Monster quotes. Set contained Ice V teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam. Garden Goblin was on the printed setlist after Set but was not played.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard - 1200
Gold Foil - 300

This show featured the debut of Intrasport, which featured Lucas on Joey's microtonal guitar and Joey on tambourine. Following Billabong Valley Joey shouted out King Stingray and their relationship to Yothu Yindi and Warumpi Band. Hypertension contained teases of Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC), La Grange (ZZ Top) and Ice V. Stu teased La Grange again before Antarctica. Joey shouted out Cookie's new Pipe-Eye album in the intro to Ambergris. A segue from Sad Pilot into Rats In the Sky was completed; immediately following the segue the show was stopped for approximately 4 minutes to help a fan who passed out and Rats was then restarted from the beginning. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained a The Dripping Tap jam with lyrics and Alter Me I teases and quotes. Cellophane contained Hog Calling Contest and Am I In Heaven? teases and featured Ambrose on sax. I'm In Your Mind Fuzz contained a tease of The Balrog.  Iron Lung contained Phantom Island quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Hypertension teases, Iron Lung teases and quotes, and Smoke & Mirrors quotes. Cavs played the drumbeat from Bitter Boogie in Muddy Water and vice versa, and each contained teases from the other, with Bitter Boogie ending in a brief Muddy Water reprise. One of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia, briefly joined the band onstage to perform a pig noise during Hog Calling Contest. Kelper-22b was played for the first time since 2023-09-02 (76 show gap), and in a new electronic arrangement.
data.soundcheck: Ambergris, Hog Calling Contest, The Book, Ataraxia, Superposition, Kepler-22b

data.shownotes: Oddlife was introduced as Cookie's favorite song. Sense was performed in it's synth arrangement and contained The Grim Reaper teases. The Grim Reaper contained Intergalactic, Sabotage, and (You Gotta) Fight for Your Right (To Party!) (all by the Beastie Boys) quotes, and at the end of the song Ambrose thanked the Beastie Boys. Wah Wah contained a The River intro with Crumbling Castle teases and the song itself contained The River quotes, Crumbling Castle teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was dedicated to Amby's hangover anxieties. Hypertension contained Extinction teases and quotes. Alter Me (unnumbered) was on the setlist before Altered Beast IV but was not played.
